latitude.description: The approximate latitude of the site in decimal degrees.

longitude.description: The approximate longitude of the site in decimal degrees.

fuel_loads_mmbtu_per_hour.description: This is the fuel energy consumption for space heating at the individual building level. This is used in the business as usual LCCA analysis in the GHP iteration and is an 8760 timeseries.
fuel_loads_mmbtu_per_hour.note: This parameter is required to run REopt's GHP module as per the REopt formatting requirements, but is not used to calculate URBANopt's GHP system LCCA. Users can set this to values close to 0 in the GHP scenario

fuel_loads_mmbtu_per_hour.description: This is the fuel consumption for the ground source heat pump (GHP) in mmbtu/hour to provide domestic hot water in the buildings. This is used in the LCCA calculation in the GHP iteration. It is an 8760 timeseries, if GHP does not provide DHW set to zeros.

load_kw.description: This is the electric load (in kW) at the building level for the GHP scenario. It is the total of secondary pump electric power, heat pump electric power and ETS pump power determined from the modelica model. This is used in the LCCA calculation in the GHP iteration.
load_kw.note: 15 min interval data do not work in GHP module. Please make sure all timeseries are 8760

ElectricTarriff.description: Label attribute of utility rate structure from https://openei.org/services/doc/rest/util_rates/?version=3

require_ghp_purchase.description: choices of 0 or 1. Always set at 1 for URBANopt's LCCA

building_sqft.description: This is the building footprint area (in sq.ft.) used to calculate cost of hydronic loop. This is used in the LCCA calculation in the GHP iteration.
building_sqft.note: For the GHX iteration, set building_sqft to a number close to 0 but not exactly 0

peak_combined_heatpump_thermal_ton.description: This is the maximum value out of the GHP heating and cooling capacity (size in ton) determined from the Modelica model. This is used in the LCCA calculation in the GHP iteration.
peak_combined_heatpump_thermal_ton.note: in the GHX iteration, set this value to a number close to 0 but NOT exactly 0.

number_of_boreholes.description: Number of boreholes on the site, determined from Thermal Network sizing and stored in the system parameter file. This is used in the LCCA calculation in the GHX iteration.
number_of_boreholes.note: in the GHP iteration, set this value to 0

length_boreholes_ft.description: The length of the borehole (in feet), determined from Thermal Network sizing. This is used in the LCCA calculation in the GHX iteration.
length_boreholes_ft.note: in the GHP iteration, set this value to 0

yearly_total_electric_consumption_series.description: 8760 timeseries of building total electric consumption. It is the total of secondary pump electric power, heat pump electric power and ETS pump power determined from the modelica model. This is used in the LCCA calculation in the GHP iteration.
yearly_total_electric_consumption_series.note: in the GHX iteration, set this value to a number close to 0 but not exactly 0

yearly_ghx_pump_electric_consumption_ser.description: 8760 timeseries of ghx's total electric consumption. It is the district pump power (in kW), calculated from the modelica model. This is used in the LCCA calculation in the GHX iteration.
yearly_ghx_pump_electric_consumption_ser.note: in the GHP iteration, set this value to 0

heating_thermal_load_mmbtu_per_hr.description: not used for URBANopt's GHP LCCA but required for formatting, set to number close to 0

cooling_thermal_load_ton.description: not used for URBANopt's GHP LCCA but required for formatting, can set as zeros

installed_cost_heatpump_per_ton.description: This is the installation cost per unit of GHP ($/ton). This value can be incorporated into the REopt GHP assumption file for use in the URBANopt GHP LCCA iteration. A default value is used if no value is provided.

installed_cost_ghx_per_ft.description: This is the installation cost per unit of GHX ($/ft). This value can be incorporated into the REopt GHP assumption file for use in the URBANopt GHX LCCA iteration. A default value is used if no value is provided.

installed_cost_building_hydronic_loop_pe.description: This is the installation cost for building hydronic loop per sqft of building footprint area ($/sqft). This value can be incorporated into the REopt GHP assumption file for use in the URBANopt GHP LCCA iteration. A default value is used if no value is provided.

om_cost_per_sqft_year.description: This is the operations and maintenance cost ($/sqft). The default value if not specified, is -$0.51, capturing saving from HVAC operation. Recommended setting at 0

macrs_bonus_fraction.description: This is the percentage of MACRS (Modified Accelarated Cost Recovery System) benefits for GHP. Value is between 0 and 1

macrs_itc_reduction.description: This is the percentage of MACRS (Modified Accelarated Cost Recovery System) benefits for GHP. Value is between 0 and 1

federal_itc_fraction.description: This is the percentage of ITC (Investment Tax Credit) benefits for GHP. Value is between 0 and 1

avoided_capex_by_ghp_present_value.description: Account for expenses avoided by addition of GHP
avoided_capex_by_ghp_present_value.note: Required to capture the avoided capital cost of the BAU system when switching to GHP. Use this to accurately calculate NPV

fuel_cost_per_mmbtu.description: This is the fuel cost per mmbtu for an existing boiler ($/mmbtu). This is used in the LCCA calculation for the business as usual cost. This is required for formatting in GHP scenario.
